comment: While homework counts for a small %, it is ESSENTIAL if you want to pass this class. A good chunk of her lectures assume that you've at least skimmed the homework. If you miss more than 1 lecture in a row, god help you because you will be super behind without help
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Sconzo is chill. She can really overreact about a lot of things regarding exams but if you keep a level head and study hard you'll be fine. If you attend her office hours and actually participate, I cant see how you cannot pass her class. Tests are pretty difficult, but she genuinely teaches you Chem which is more than I can about other professors

Ms. Sconzo was a great professor. Chem is a tough subject overall I got a B and I never read the book and only paid attention to her lectures. She gives quizzes but she gives a chance to replace all test grades so dont worry if you do bad. The final is 4 sections and has the ability to replace all your test grades. Great professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Competent at lecturing, but her tests are something else. She will throw questions on there that she has not properly gone over in class, and will drill quizzes into you with material that is two exams away. Was doing okay, but after we went online after COVID19 hit, her adaptation was very poor. Does not seem to care if her own mistakes affect you
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Her class was more unorganized than the KSU chem department. She takes notes as she goes, which means no slides to look back on. She'll bounce back and forth between sheets of paper so often that idk if she even knows where she's at. You miss a class? Tough nubs, you're far behind now. Beware of quizzes, they're random and might take all class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: If you can avoid it do not take her. Go to every class because you will not pass if you skip, there is very little homework (the one time that I would say that is a bad thing because you get hardly any practice before a test) and is lecture heavyyyyyy. There are a lot of pop quizzes and tests have material on it that she does not discuss in class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Lots of homework is just a Chemistry department thing, not a Sconzo thing. All of her lectures are notes written live instead of being read off slides. Missing 1 lecture will mean you WILL be 100% lost in the next lecture, so don't miss them. Lots of homework assignments and plenty of extra credit means don't worry about low test grades+she curves
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Her tests are ridiculously difficult. She puts things on the test that she has not gone over, which makes studying a chore. She doesn't use PowerPoints and barely gives homework so practice is limited. Quizzes are hard(& half the time random) & you don't get enough time to finish. Over half of the class is struggling and she doesn't seem to care.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Her tests WILL NOT line up with her lectures or what she says will be on the test. Half the time it will be a 1212 test. Her quizzes are all handwritten, and she will give you a grand total of 30 seconds per question if youre lucky. If you have bad handwriting, she will fail you and call you out in front of the entire class repeatedly for it.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: A good person, HARD class. Extensive lectures and surprise quizzes, so COME TO CLASS!! Quizzes are pretty simple usually, just make sure you know what's going on. Her tests WILL make you cry. They usually contain material she did not cover in class so, say your prayers. People who went to her SI sessions still failed her tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Mrs. Sconzo is tough, but fair. She approaches the class with intent to teach the material, and is available several times outside of class for questions. Not a class you can slack off in, but if you are willing to put in a little work she will teach you the material extremely well. Would highly recommend, especially if you'll also take 1212.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Her test are hard and will bring you to tears but she works with and by the time you make it to the final you will go through the ACS exam with easy. Best to attend her before and after class session, she gives additional information and really cares that you understand the concepts.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Overall, she is a good teacher she wants you to pass, well that's if you put in the effort. Mastering Chemistry deadlines will sneak up on you and the quizzes in class. Make sure you ask for help and go to her review session before or after class. Make sure she knows your name. Test aren't all multiple choice so study hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Once you get into the class, you will need to adjust your learning style to match her's. Then if you pay attention during the lectures, you should have no problem passing the class. She does give ridiculous quizzes that are difficult and the tests are no laughing matter. However, once you take the ACS final, she will have prepared you to make an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: Moves very fast. Homework only helps a little with tests. Tests are super difficult. Be ready for some challenging quizzes almost every class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: I have a lot of mixed feelings about her, on one hand she's probably one of the most caring professor I've ever had but, her class made me cry several times. Overall, I hated everything about the way she taught her lecture BUT she dedicates so much time to helping people before/after class. If it weren't for those review sessions I would've failed.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: You will learn with the professor. Notes are incredible. Make sure to study, tests are tough
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Worst professor I've ever had. She assumes that every person in the classroom is a chemist and knows exactly what they're doing & are capable of working through problems quickly and easily. She's set in her ways and will not accept any shown work on the exams that doesn't fit her criteria of factor labeling. If you're stuck with her, I'll pray 4 u.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: For the love of everything holy, PLEASE DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. Over half the class dropped within the first two months, she does not give enough time to complete quizzes, she doesn't teach everything that is on the test, and she has a habit of starting class 5 or 10 minutes early as well as going up to 15 minutes late. Avoid her at ALL COSTS.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Please don't make this mistake of taking this professor. I ignored the negative reviews and oh man, this was one of my biggest mistakes. Half of the class dropped. She is disrespectful to students, doesn't curve, doesn't cover all the material that she tests on, gives inadequate time for quizzes, and treats everyone like middle schoolers. RUN AWAY!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The most unreasonable professor you could come across - it's almost inhuman how uncompromising she is. Chemistry is already a difficult subject as it is, and with her added aggressive attitude and way of teaching, it makes this course pretty unbearable. (ps: you get max 5 mins to finish her quizzes and does not care that half the class failed)
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Her class starts off quick and makes you learn too much in too little time. If you do not do the work the exact same way as her, which is more complicated, you are wrong. If you get the same answer as her, but you do it differently, you are wrong
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: She gives you 5 minutes in class to complete a quiz, and she wastes about 15-20 minutes of testing time to individually sit a 150 person class.

Her tests are nothing like her homework, her study guides, the examples she does in class, or the textbook. No matter how hard you study for a test, you will still end up with a crappy grade. She will also often make you take quizzes at the beginning of class on topics you literally just learned last class, and she will only give you 2-3 minutes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Lots of homework and exams are VERY VERY different from her "study guides"/lectures.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: If you can... avoid this professor, but if she's the only one that fits your schedule beware!!! Her testing methods are excessive. The tests themselves are on a totally different level than the material shown in class so... good luck!!! Essentially, you're going have to teach everything to yourself and constantly review to retain the information.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: I did not enjoy my time in her class. The material is dry and she focuses in on a few topics, but the tests are far too extensive and way too specific for her teaching style. And her testing procedure is the absolute worst. Wastes 10 minutes passing out tests and has a very specific and frankly unnecessary seating. I do not recommend her class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: She is very passionate and has great lectures. She underlines the fundaments and continuously builds upon that. She has 4 exams (1 drops) and an ACS final. Not always available after class if working part time, but will make exceptions. You need to know the fundamentals! Pay attention and give 100% effort from day 1 to earn a good grade.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She never tells you whats on the tests and if she does it's not true. She expects you to already know chemistry.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: I love the professor, but the material is hard. a third of the class dropped out, and you feel like your failing the whole semester BUT if you go to the sessions after or before class, she will take the time to learn your name and see that you were working hard to learn. You have to work for the grade, but you can make an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Be prepared to work your tail off. The amount of stuff you are required to memorize is insane and the homework is constant. If I had one word to describe her it would be Extra. She is really nice outside of class but in class it is rough.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Sconzo is awesome,  and she tries to teach you everything that is needed to pass the test. It is better if you take the lab with her so that she knows on a personal level and tries to help you as she teaches the lecture. She does go over the lecture time so try not to have a class right after hers.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: If you are among the students that are taking Chemistry late in your academic career, do not take it with Professor Sconzo. There is a lot of work that can detract from more important classes. Do not schedule a class right after her lecture because you will not make it in time if a class is scheduled 15 minutes after.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Sconzo is brilliant, but very difficult. Beware of Test 2, and go to all of the SI or professor sessions outside of class. Chemistry is hard, but you will know your stuff if you take her. You can get an A if you have already taken Chemistry and are willing to put in the work.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: This is not an easy subject period, but Sconzo taught it well. However, if she would stop going off on little rants and not rush through things when it is actually time to teach, students would probably learn more. She does provide extra help, but good luck getting into her office hours as her office is always packed with people.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very nice teacher. She is TOO organized. Talked through every test of the senester and took 15 minutes minimum just for attendance of 150+ students. Hard grader but gave some extra pts here & there. Unfortunately thats not enogh. Read the chapters thoroughly because you wont learn much in class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Sconzo is great at teaching the material. She teaches it in a way that students will understand. Her tests she gives test all of the material taught and some that has yet to be taught. She is more than willing to help any student. She is a really tough grader and the quizzes are all free response a worded very weird. Getting a B is hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She really cares about her students. Her tests are hard but they do test  your knowledge. If you don't know something just ask. She is very straightforward. She explains things in a way that make it easy to understand. I would take her again if i could. She is one of the best chemistry teachers and she really knows her stuff.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is very passionate about Chemistry, and very intelligent. Her lectures are very well given and she is always available in her office for extra help. She gave a significant amount of time outside of lecture to help the stragglers get a passing grade. If you take her, understand that she will make you work for the grade, but you'll be better off.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: She very nice sweet lady help me do good.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Sconzo clearly cares about her students learning, but her organization skills drove me mad at the beginning. Attendance with 150 people was annoying and took up too much class time. She talks through exams and quizzes, so bring ear plugs. First exam had questions we didn't learn until the following week, so read ahead of syllabus chapters
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: I absolutely adored Professor Sconzo! She made chemistry much easier for me and the entire class to understand! She would stay as late as you needed her if you had questions or didn't understand something. She would demonstrate the lab for the evening and then turn you loose with you partner. Make sure to complete your labs BEFORE class!!
rating_tags: Inspirational--Caring

comment: Best professor i have had a KSU! She really cares about her students and wants you to pass. Must go to class! Must do labs before class not during! Must wear clothing appropriate for lab or you will get kicked out & receive a 0 for the day. Listen and go to class an hour early she will help you. I would take her again.

Lab structure at KSU is the same no matter the professor. Prelab quizzes, lab notebooks, lab reports, and final exam. Pay attention to math in individual labs bc it is on final. Sconzo was great and would help after class on the past weeks lab so me and my partner understood it and also was very helpful during the lab to make sure it was done right

Prof. Sconzo is such a sweet, caring person. She knows her stuff and is willing to help anyone. She does require a little more than other lab instructors, but it pays off in the end. She is always willing to go the extra mile to clear any confusion you may have. I recommend taking her, especially if you don't have a good lecture professor.
This class is not a super easy one but she is more than willing to help and will always make herself available to you. I definitely recommend her!

She's not a bad teacher, but the work she requires of you is tedious and trivial. She'll have you copy the lab book word for word for each lab as well as other such tasks. On the bright side, she is a very nice teacher and seems to love what she does and knows her stuff, but she doesn't make the class easy for those of you that just want to pass.
Easy A. Watch for sig fig. same criteria for other chem labs. But the she really sweet.  Take her she is great.
